document.docAuthor: Chani-Posse, Mariana, Newton, Alfred F., Hansen, Aslak Kappel & Solodovnikov, Alexey
document.masterDocTitle: Checklist and taxonomic changes for Central and South American Philonthina (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist and taxonomic changes for Central and South American Philonthina (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Cafius
Stephens 1829a : 23
, attributed to Leach. Type species:
Staphylinus xantholoma Gravenhorst, 1806
, designated by Curtis 1830 : pl. 322.

=
Euremus
Bierig 1934 : 68
, nomen nudum (as subgenus of
Cafius
; no type species designation).

=
Euremus
Blackwelder 1943 : 435
(as subgenus of
Cafius
; validation of
Euremus Bierig
by designation of type species). Type species:
Philonthus bistriatus Erichson, 1840
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Notes: There are 44 valid species of
Cafius
distributed worldwide from the Pacific, Atlantic, Indian, Mediterranean and Red Sea coasts (Newton unpublished database). Among them, 11 species have been recorded from the Neotropical region and two species from Southern South America ( Chile ). Notwithstanding
C. bisulcatus (Solier)
and
C. xantholoma (Solier)
from Chile , the remaining species show a broader distribution in the Nearctic region.
Jeon et al. (2012)
found
Cafius
and most of its subgenera not to be monophyletic, with
Remus
and some other small non-CASA genera nested within the genus, and therefore did not recognize subgenera.
Chani-Posse et al. (2018)
also show
Cafius
as a non-monophyletic genus, whose representatives form a species complex in a potential sister-group relationship to the so called
Philonthus
complex. The current concept of the genus is that of Smetana (1995) .

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Philonthus bistriatus
Erichson 1840 : 502
. Type locality: America septentrionalis Insula Longa [ Long Island ]. Type depository: ZMHB HT. Distribution: Canada (NB, NL, NS, PE, QC), USA (east coast),
Mexico
(Caribbean coast), Venezuela , Bahamas , Cuba , Jamaica , DR, Puerto Rico , Mona Is., Virgin Is., Antigua , Barbados , Carriacou, Dominica , Grenada ,
Grenadines
, Guadeloupe ,
Montserrat
, St. Kitts , St. Lucia ,
Tobago
, Trinidad ,?Galápagos Is. Notes: comb. nov. ex
Philonthus (
Fauvel 1874: 196
)
;
ssp. bistriatus (Erichson) in
Frank & Ahn (2011: 33)
; distribution (Orth & Moore 1980 , Frank et al. 1986, Frank & Ahn 2011 ), within
Mexico
(
Navarrete-Heredia et al. 2002
); distribution, also within Cuba ( Peck 2005 ), Dominica (Peck 2006), Barbados ( Peck 2009a ), Lesser Antilles ( Peck 2011a : Northern Leeward Is.,
Peck et al. 2014
: Guadeloupe Archipelago); species (as "
cf. bistriatus
", not identified to subspecies) reported from Galápagos Islands by Newton & Peck (2006) .

=
Philonthus bilineatus
Erichson 1840 : 503
. Type locality: ins St. Johannis [St. John, Virgin Is.]. Type depository: ZMHB HT. Distribution: Virgin Is. (St. John). Note: as
Cafius
, comb. nov. ex
Philonthus (
Scheerpeltz 1933 : 1369
)
; as synonym of
C. bistriatus
Blackwelder (1943: 438)
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Cafius bistriatus fulgens Frank et al. 1986: 153
. Type locality: Mulege, Baja California Sur. Type depository: CNC HT ♂, 13 PT. Distribution: USA (California), Mexico (northwest). Note:
ssp. fulgens Frank
and distribution (Frank et al. 1986: 153, Frank & Ahn 2011 : 33) within Mexico (
Navarrete-Heredia et al. 2002
).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Staphylinus bisulcatus
Solier 1849 : 314
. Type locality: [no specific locality] [Chile]. Type depository: MNHN? #?ST. Distribution: Chile;?Australia. Notes: as
Philonthus (
Fairmaire & Germain 1862: 432
)
; comb. nov. ex
Philonthus (
Fauvel 1874: 196
)
; distribution ( Frank & Ahn 2011 ), within Chile ( Ferrú & Elgueta 2011 ).

Philonthus canescens
Mannerheim 1852 : 313
. Type depository: MCZ LT ♀. Type locality: insula Edgecombe. Distribution: Canada (w), USA (w), Mexico. Note: comb. nov. ex
Philonthus (
Fauvel 1874: 196
)
; lectotype designation, redescription, distribution (Orth &
Moore 1980 : 186
); distribution within Mexico (Navarrete- Heredia et al. 2002); distribution ( Frank & Ahn 2011 ).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Cafius caribeanus
Bierig 1934 : 68
(as a variety of C. corallicola (Fairmaire)). Type depository: FMNH 2 ST. Type locality: Playa de Marianao, Cuba . Distribution: USA ,
Mexico
,
Panama
, Venezuela , Brazil , Cuba , Jamaica , Puerto Rico , Antigua , Carriacou, Dominica , Grenada , Guadeloupe , St. Croix, Trinidad . Notes: as a valid species (
Blackwelder 1943: 437
); distribution (Orth & Moore 1980 , Peck 2011b ), also within
Mexico
(
Navarrete-Heredia et al. 2002
); distribution, also within Cuba ( Peck 2005 ), Dominica (Peck 2006), Lesser Antilles ( Peck 2011a : Northern Leeward Is.,
Peck et al. 2014
: Guadeloupe Archipelago); distribution including USA ( Frank & Ahn 2011 ); distribution including
Panama
, also within Brazil (Asenjo et al. 2013).

Philonthus decipiens
LeConte 1863 : 40
. Type locality: San Diego , California [ North America ]
. Type depository:

Moore 1980 : 198

subSubSection.paragraph:
Cafius xantholoma ( Gravenhorst, 1806 )
[adventive in CASA , or misidentification?]

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Staphylinus xantholoma
Gravenhorst 1806 : 41
. Type depository: ZMHB ?. Type locality: Rostochii. Distribution: Europe, Ukraine , Morocco , Algeria , Tunisia , Libya , Egypt , Turkey , Azores, Canary Is., Iceland ; adventive? in South Africa , Chile . Notes: comb. nov. ex
Staphylinus (
Curtis, 1829: 26
)
; South Africa record FMNH (not in Herman 2001d ); distribution within Chile ( Ferrú & Elgueta 2011 ); Chile as "later shown to be based on misidentification" (
Frank & Ahn 2011: 56
) but without reference to source; Neotropical (i.e., Chile ) also indicated as adventive (
Schülke & Smetana 2015 : 1020
).
